job_description:
Business Analyst

The Business Analyst plays a key role in ensuring requirements are clearly understood, accurately documented, and traceable throughout the software development lifecycle. This role focuses on translating business and functional inputs into structured, standardized documentation that supports effective development, testing, and delivery. Working closely with business analysts, design teams, and technical stakeholders, the role ensures consistency, clarity, and alignment across all requirement artifacts.

Key Responsibilities

  • Create Software Requirement Specifications (SRS) based on inputs from Core Business Analysts, stakeholder discussions, and requirement walkthroughs
  • Prepare Business Requirement Documents (BRD) using approved templates while ensuring business intent and system behavior are clearly documented
  • Participate in requirement discussions to understand business objectives, functional flows, dependencies, and assumptions before documentation
  • Analyze requirements to identify gaps, ambiguities, and inconsistencies, and work with Core BAs to resolve them
  • Document functional flows, business rules, and acceptance criteria where applicable to support development and QA teams
  • Document wireframes, UI flows, validations, and UI specifications in collaboration with design and product teams
  • Maintain change logs, version history, and document updates throughout the project lifecycle
  • Create and manage traceability matrices linking business, functional, and technical requirements
  • Maintain cross-references across BRD, SRS, UI, API, and related documentation
  • Ensure documentation consistency, completeness, and alignment with approved scope and delivery timelines
  • Ensure accurate and timely PMS updates with structured documentation details
  • Support development, QA, UAT, and audit processes through clear, traceable, and up-to-date documentation
  • Assist in requirement reviews, walkthroughs, and validation sessions with internal and client stakeholders

Requirements

Required Skills and Experience - 1 to 4 years of experience in Business Analysis documentation or related roles - Strong experience in BRD and SRS creation - Hands-on experience with documentation templates, standards, and version control - Ability to document UI wireframes and functional flows clearly - Working knowledge of APIs and system integrations for documentation purposes - Experience with project management systems and documentation tools - Strong attention to detail and ability to manage multiple documents in parallel - Excellent written communication and stakeholder coordination skills

Minimum Qualifications - Bachelor’s degree in Engineering, Computer Science, Information Systems, or a related field - 1 to 4 years of experience as a Business Analyst or Product Analyst

Benefits

  • A growth-driven environment with opportunities to lead, innovate, and upskill continuously.

If this opportunity aligns with your career goals, kindly share your updated resume with us at careers@2basetechnologies.com
summary: The Business Analyst translates business needs into structured documentation, ensuring clarity and traceability across development. Responsibilities include creating BRDs/SRS, analyzing requirements, and maintaining documentation consistency.

job_description:
Senior Business Analyst

At 2Base, we are rebuilding the Business Analyst function into a world-class, product-minded, clarity-driven team. This role is not a documentation role. It is not a screen updater role. It is not a support role. This is a core Business Analyst position responsible for functional modeling, system reasoning, requirement clarity, and building the foundation for correct development.

Key Responsibilities

  • Lead requirement workshops, client calls, and discovery discussions to understand business needs clearly.
  • Ask deeper questions, challenge assumptions, and validate the true business intent behind every requirement.
  • Convert ambiguous client inputs into structured, logical, and actionable functional understanding.
  • Break large features into modules, workflows, components, and clear dependencies.
  • Build strong system-level understanding involving APIs, integrations, data flow, and backend considerations.
  • Translate business processes into functional logic that development teams can execute.
  • Decompose requirements into use-case flows, system behaviors, edge cases, alternate paths, validation rules, and dependencies.
  • Prepare high-quality documentation, including BRD, FRD, SRS, workflows, state diagrams, data-flow diagrams, API requirement specs, and acceptance criteria.
  • Ensure all documentation is clear, logical, structured, testable, and ready for developers and QA to use.
  • Collaborate closely with developers, architects, QA, and product owners to validate feasibility and align understanding.
  • Ensure QA teams can derive test cases effectively from your functional logic and acceptance criteria.
  • Communicate confidently with clients, handle requirement discussions smoothly, and clarify misunderstandings immediately.
  • Push back politely on unclear or changing requirements and ensure final decisions are documented properly.
  • Maintain requirement traceability throughout the lifecycle and ensure zero ambiguity during handover to development.
  • Own the entire requirement lifecycle from discovery to development readiness with high accountability.
  • Drive clarity across teams by ensuring every requirement is complete, validated, and logically consistent.

Required Skills & Experience

  • Minimum 4+ years of core Business Analyst experience with strong analytical and system-level thinking.
  • Ability to break down complex requirements into clear components, workflows, and functional logic.
  • Excellent verbal and written communication with confidence in client interactions and clarifications.
  • Proven experience in preparing SRS, BRD, FRD, workflows, and acceptance criteria with high clarity.
  • Ability to challenge assumptions politely, ask the right questions, and ensure zero ambiguity.
  • Strong collaboration experience with development, QA, architects, and cross-functional teams.
  • Understanding of API behaviors, integrations, data flows, and multi-module system interactions.
  • Ability to run requirement discussions, workshops, and independently lead discovery sessions.
  • Exposure to SaaS, scalable products, automation, or AI-supported systems is an added advantage.
  • Demonstrated ownership of requirements end-to-end, ensuring developer-ready and testable outputs.
  • Not suitable for UI-only thinkers, passive communicators, template-based writers, or those relying on AI for answers.
  • Success is defined by clear, testable requirements, zero rework, strong cross-team alignment, and confident communication.

Minimum Qualifications

  • Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Business, or related field
  • 4 to 8 years of experience as a Business Analyst or Product Analyst
  • Experience in SaaS or scalable product environments
  • Exposure to AI/Automation, integrations, or multi-module systems
  • Ability to run independent client workshops
  • Must have independently handled requirement ownership for at least one full project lifecycle

Benefits

  • A growth-driven environment with opportunities to lead, innovate, and upskill continuously.

If this opportunity aligns with your career goals, kindly share your updated resume with us at careers@2basetechnologies.com.
summary: Senior Business Analyst role at 2Base focuses on functional modeling, system reasoning, and clear requirement documentation. Requires 4+ years of experience in SaaS, AI/Automation, and API integrations with strong analytical and communication skills.

job_description:
Sr. DevSecOps Engineer

We are seeking a Senior DevSecOps Engineer to lead cybersecurity, infrastructure automation, and DevSecOps practices as we transition to a secure, scalable, and modern engineering environment. This role will strengthen 2Base’s security posture, modernize pipelines, and foster a secure-by-design culture. You will collaborate with engineering, product, and leadership teams to ensure systems, applications, and cloud environments are secure, reliable, and future-ready.

Key Responsibilities

  • Define, implement, and enforce security standards, policies, and best practices across cloud and on-prem environments.
  • Conduct security risk assessments, vulnerability scans, penetration testing, and mitigation plans.
  • Architect and enhance secure CI/CD pipelines with automated compliance and governance checkpoints.
  • Promote a "Security First" culture, ensuring secure design and development practices.
  • Monitor, detect, investigate, and respond to security threats, incidents, breaches, and anomalies.
  • Develop Infrastructure-as-Code practices using Terraform, Ansible, and automation frameworks.
  • Design secure cloud architectures across AWS, Azure, or GCP for scalable, compliant deployments.
  • Build and secure containerized environments with Docker and Kubernetes, enforcing security baselines.
  • Implement secure monitoring, logging, SIEM, and alerting systems for infrastructure and applications.
  • Improve system reliability, scalability, performance, and fault tolerance across critical workloads.
  • Mentor DevOps engineers in secure development, automation, and operational excellence.
  • Lead technical strategy, tool selection, process improvements, and DevSecOps roadmap execution.
  • Collaborate with BA, PM, and Engineering teams to align security, performance, and delivery goals.

Required Skills & Experience

  • 4–8 years of experience in DevOps, Cloud, or Infrastructure engineering with strong security exposure.
  • Hands-on experience with CI/CD tools (Jenkins, GitLab CI, GitHub Actions).
  • Expertise in AWS, Azure, or GCP cloud platforms with a focus on secure architecture.
  • Proficiency in Infrastructure-as-Code (Terraform, Ansible).
  • Experience securing Docker and Kubernetes environments.
  • Strong understanding of networking technologies (LAN/WAN, firewalls, VPN, load balancers).
  • Knowledge of security frameworks (OWASP, NIST, CIS Benchmarks).
  • Experience with monitoring/logging tools (Prometheus, Grafana, ELK, CloudWatch, SIEM).
  • Strong scripting skills (Python, Bash, Shell).
  • Excellent troubleshooting, analytical, and problem-solving skills.
  • Strong communication and collaboration abilities to influence engineering teams.

Contact: Share your resume at careers@2basetechnologies.com.
summary: Senior DevSecOps Engineer leads cybersecurity and infrastructure automation, ensuring secure-by-design practices across cloud environments.

  • High-Impact Presentations: Design and deliver compelling product demonstrations and technical pitches, proving the feasibility and superiority of our AI portfolio to C-suite and technical evaluators alike.

Role Summary

The RCM Operations Team Lead will oversee day-to-day revenue cycle operations, ensure billing accuracy, improve process efficiency, and lead a team to meet performance targets.

Key Roles & Responsibilities

  1. Operational Management
  2. Oversee end-to-end RCM processes.
  3. Monitor daily productivity and quality metrics.
  4. Ensure compliance with payer guidelines, HIPAA regulations, and healthcare billing standards.

  5. Ensure timely claim submission and follow-up to meet revenue targets.

  6. Team Leadership & Supervision

  7. Manage and guide a team of RCM Executives/Analysts.
  8. Conduct daily huddles and weekly performance reviews.
  9. Identify training needs and coordinate refresher sessions.
  10. Provide feedback and performance improvement plans (PIP) where required.

  11. Ensure adherence to attendance, shift schedules, and discipline standards.

  12. Quality & Compliance

  13. Conduct periodic quality audits of claims and follow-up documentation.
  14. Ensure SOP adherence and update process documentation as needed.
  15. Maintain compliance with HIPAA and client-specific policies.

  16. Support internal and external audits.

  17. Process Improvement & Reporting

job_description:
Certified Professional Medical Auditor (CPMA)

Job Summary

We are seeking a highly detailed and analytical Certified Professional Medical Auditor (CPMA) to join our team. This role is responsible for conducting comprehensive, end-to-end audits of the entire claim lifecycle, from initial patient encounter to final account resolution. The ideal candidate will leverage their expertise in coding, billing, and compliance to identify inaccuracies, revenue leakage, and non-compliance with payer guidelines and standard practices. This position will be instrumental in improving the accuracy, efficiency, and timeliness of our revenue cycle operations.

Roles and Responsibilities

Your primary responsibility will be to perform detailed audits across all stages of the revenue cycle.

Core Audit Functions

  • Clinical Documentation & Encounter Audit:
  • Review clinical documentation to ensure the services billed are fully supported, medically necessary, and accurately reflect the care provided.
  • Verify that a billable encounter is properly established and documented for each claim created.

  • Audit for specificity in documentation to support correct ICD-10, CPT, and HCPCS code selection.

  • Front-End & Charge Capture Audit:

  • Audit patient demographic (demo) entry and insurance verification records for completeness and accuracy (e.g., correct spelling of names, DOB, policy numbers).
  • Review the charge entry (charge capture) process to ensure all services documented were correctly charged and that no unbundling or upcoding occurred.

  • Validate that CPT/HCPCS codes and modifiers are used correctly according to NCCI (National Correct Coding Initiative) edits and payer-specific policies.

  • Claims & Billing Audit:

  • Analyze submitted claims (CMS-1500 or UB-04) to confirm they are "clean" and adhere to all payer guidelines and standard billing practices.
  • Verify that claims are submitted within the payers' timely filing limits.

  • Identify trends in claim rejections and denials originating from submission errors.

  • Back-End & Follow-up Audit:

  • Audit payment posting to ensure payments, adjustments, and patient responsibilities are posted accurately against the correct charges.
  • Verify that contractual adjustments are applied correctly based on payer fee schedules and contracts.
  • Evaluate the quality and effectiveness of Accounts Receivable (AR) follow-up actions, including the rework of denied claims and the substance of appeals.

Process & Timeliness Audits

  • Timeliness & Efficiency:
  • Audit the turnaround time (TAT) at each stage of the claim lifecycle (e.g., charge lag, claim submission lag, payment posting lag, denial rework time).

  • Monitor key performance indicators (KPIs) such as Days in AR, Clean Claim Rate, and Denial Rate to identify bottlenecks and delays.

  • Reporting & Education:

  • Prepare detailed audit reports with findings, root cause analysis, and quantifiable financial impact.
  • Present findings and corrective action recommendations to department managers and staff.

  • Serve as a subject matter expert, providing education and feedback to coders, billers, front-desk staff, and AR teams to prevent future errors.

  • Compliance:

  • Ensure all audited processes remain in strict compliance with federal and state regulations, including HIPAA and OIG guidelines.
  • Assist in external audits (e.g., RAC, payer) as needed.

Qualifications and Skills

Required: - CPMA (Certified Professional Medical Auditor) certification from the AAPC. - Additional Certification: Must also hold at least one of the following: CPC (Certified Professional Coder), COC (Certified Outpatient Coder), or CPB (Certified Professional Biller). - Experience: Minimum of 3-5 years of hands-on experience in medical auditing, coding, or full-cycle revenue cycle management. - Expert Knowledge: Deep understanding of medical terminology, anatomy, CPT, ICD-10-CM, and HCPCS Level II coding systems. - Payer Expertise: Proficient in interpreting commercial, Medicare, and Medicaid payer policies and reimbursement guidelines. - Analytical Skills: Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with an ability to identify trends and patterns in complex data. - Communication: Excellent written and verbal communication skills, with the ability to present complex audit findings clearly and professionally. - Software: Proficiency in using EMR/EHR systems and Practice Management (PM) software. Strong skills in Microsoft Excel for data analysis and reporting.

Preferred: - Experience auditing both physician (pro-fee) and facility (outpatient) claims. - Associate's or Bachelor's degree in Healthcare Administration, Business, or a related field. - Experience with data analytics tools or advanced Excel functions (e.g., pivot tables, VLOOKUP).

Contact: If this opportunity aligns with your career goals, kindly share your updated resume with us at recruiter@aimagroup.co.uk.
summary: A CPMA-certified auditor is needed to conduct end-to-end medical claim audits, ensuring compliance and accuracy. The role improves revenue cycle efficiency through detailed analysis and reporting.

The ideal candidate will have deep expertise in SharePoint Online and On-Premises, along with strong proficiency in Microsoft Azure services, particularly Logic Apps, Azure Runbooks, and PnP PowerShell.   • SharePoint solution architecture: Design and implement scalable SharePoint solutions (SharePoint Online; SharePoint Server if required) aligned to business needs.

  • Azure Functions development: Build and maintain Azure Functions (HTTP/Queue/Timer triggers) following best practices for reliability and maintainability.
  • API Management & API security: Use Azure API Management (APIM) to publish and secure APIs, apply policies, and manage routing/versioning.

  • Azure AD / Entra ID: App registrations, permissions/consent, OAuth flows, managed identities, and RBAC for Azure resources and integrations.
  • Automation & scripting: Develop operational automation using Power Automate/Logic Apps/Runbooks and scripting (PnP PowerShell) where applicable.
  • SPFx / customization: Develop custom SharePoint components using SPFx (React), and use PnP/CSOM/JSOM as needed for extensions and automation.
  • Troubleshooting & support: Diagnose and resolve complex issues across SharePoint, Graph, Azure Functions, and API integrations in production environments.
  • Observability & monitoring: Implement logging/metrics/tracing, dashboards, and alerts for operational visibility and faster incident resolution.
  • Delivery & leadership: Collaborate with stakeholders, translate requirements into solutions, document designs, and mentor team members/code reviews.

  • 5 to 10 years of experience in SharePoint architecture and development.
  • Strong expertise in PnP PowerShell, SharePoint Framework (SPFx), and REST APIs.
  • Proven experience with Azure Logic Apps, Azure Automation (Runbooks), and Microsoft Graph API.
  • Deep understanding of SharePoint Online, SharePoint 2013/2016/2019, and hybrid configurations.
  • Experience with PowerShell scripting and automation in enterprise environments.
  • Familiarity with CI/CD pipelines and DevOps practices for SharePoint and Azure deployments.

Certifications

  • Microsoft certifications (e.g., MS-600, AZ-204, MS-700).

job_description:
About Innovatix Technology Partners

Innovatix Technology Partners (formerly Macrosoft, Inc.) is a global leader in Legacy Application Modernization & Customer Communication Management. We partner with enterprise clients to solve complex challenges in Cloud, AI, Automation, and Legacy Modernization. As we expand our footprint, we are seeking a high-impact sales leader to drive our IT Staffing & Professional Services division, connecting top-tier US talent with our clients' critical initiatives.

The Opportunity

We are seeking a Senior Business Development Manager with a "Hunter" DNA. In this role, you will not rely on portals or passive leads. You will be the engine of our growth, identifying and breaking into new accounts across North America. You will target C-level executives (CIOs, CTOs) and Hiring Managers to sell our IT Staffing and Solution services.

Key Responsibilities

  • New Client Acquisition (Hunting): Identify, target, and break into new direct clients (End Clients) in the US market.
  • Full Cycle Sales: Manage the entire sales lifecycle from lead generation and cold calling to MSA (Master Service Agreement) negotiation and deal closure.
  • Relationship Building: Develop strong relationships with decision-makers (Directors of Engineering, VPs of IT, Procurement Managers) to understand their technical roadmaps and staffing gaps.
  • Strategic Networking: Leverage LinkedIn, professional networks, and industry events to build a robust pipeline of job orders (Reqs).
  • Market Intelligence: Stay updated on US tech trends (AI, Cloud, DevOps, Data Engineering) to have consultative conversations with hiring managers, moving beyond "keyword matching" to "solution selling."
  • Collaboration: Work closely with our recruiting team to ensure high-quality delivery. Qualify requirements rigorously to ensure we are working on fillable, high-priority roles.
  • Account Management: Once a client is acquired, nurture the account to increase our "wallet share," expanding from a single placement to becoming their primary vendor.

Preferred Skills & Requirements

  • Experience: 5+ years of core experience in Business Development for US IT Staffing (specifically acquiring Direct Clients).
  • Sales Acumen: Proven track record of closing MSAs and generating revenue. You must be comfortable with cold calling, email campaigns, and social selling.
  • Technical Familiarity: Strong understanding of the IT landscape. You should know the difference between Java and JavaScript, or Data Engineering and Data Science, to speak the client's language.
  • US Market Knowledge: Expert knowledge of US Tax Terms (W2, C2C, 1099), Visa Classifications (H1B, OPT, USC, GC), and employment laws.
  • Communication: Exceptional verbal and written English skills. You must be able to command a room (virtual or physical) with US executives.
  • Tools: Proficiency with CRM tools (Salesforce, HubSpot, Ceipal, or similar), LinkedIn Sales Navigator, and ZoomInfo.

Contact Email: jobs@innovatixinc.com Closing Date: April 5, 2026
summary: Senior Business Development Manager needed for Innovatix Technology Partners to drive new client acquisition in US IT Staffing, requiring 5+ years of experience in direct client sales and technical expertise.

Designation: Financial Analyst – R2R

Experience: Strong hands-on experience in Record to Report (R2R) functions (Freshers please excuse)

Role Overview

We are seeking a skilled Financial Analyst – R2R to manage and support financial reporting, reconciliations, and compliance activities for our SME clients. The ideal candidate will have strong practical exposure to month-end close processes, financial reporting, and reconciliations, along with proficiency in Xero and other ERP systems. This role requires ownership within the R2R cycle and the ability to ensure accurate, timely, and compliant financial reporting.

Key Responsibilities

General Ledger Management - Maintain and ensure the integrity of general ledger accounts. - Execute month-end and year-end close activities, including journal entries, accruals, and adjustments. - Review ledger postings for accuracy and compliance.

Reconciliations - Prepare and review monthly balance sheet reconciliations. - Perform bank, AR, AP, VAT, payroll, and intercompany reconciliations. - Identify and resolve reconciling items in a timely manner. - Maintain proper documentation for audit readiness.

Financial Reporting - Prepare monthly, quarterly, and annual financial statements. - Ensure compliance with applicable accounting standards (IFRS/GAAP). - Assist in presenting financial data and insights to stakeholders.

Variance Analysis - Conduct variance analysis against budgets and forecasts. - Investigate discrepancies and provide financial insights. - Support management with data-driven recommendations.

Compliance and Controls - Ensure adherence to company policies and internal controls. - Manage VAT filings and reconciliations. - Oversee PAYE filings and reconciliations. - Support statutory compliance requirements.

Stakeholder Coordination - Collaborate with AP, AR, Treasury, and cross-functional teams. - Support client communication related to financial reporting.

Management Accounts - Prepare management accounts including: - P&L statements - Balance Sheets - Cash Flow analysis - Provide analytical insights to support decision-making.

Audit Support - Coordinate with auditors and provide required documentation. - Address audit queries and assist in implementing corrective actions.

Process Improvement - Identify opportunities to enhance efficiency within the R2R process. - Support system improvements and reporting automation in Xero and other ERP systems.

Sales KPI Reporting - Develop and maintain sales performance reports and KPIs. - Analyze revenue trends and provide actionable insights.

Preferred Qualifications and Skills

  • Strong hands-on experience in Record-to-Report (R2R) or similar finance roles.
  • Solid knowledge of accounting principles and standards (IFRS/GAAP).
  • Proficiency in Xero and other ERP systems.
  • Advanced proficiency in Microsoft Excel for financial modeling, reconciliations, and data analysis.
  • Excellent analytical, problem-solving, and communication skills.
  • Ability to manage multiple tasks and meet tight deadlines in a dynamic environment.
  • Strong understanding of month-end close processes, reconciliations, and financial reporting.

Preferred Qualifications

  • Professional certification (e.g., ACCA, CPA, CMA) is an advantage.
  • Experience working with SME clients in a fast-paced, multi-entity environment.
  • Exposure to international accounting and reporting standards.

Why Join Us?

  • Opportunity to work with a diverse portfolio of SME clients.
  • Exposure to international accounting and financial reporting standards.
  • Collaborative, performance-driven, and growth-oriented work environment.
  • Clear learning and career progression opportunities.
summary: Financial Analyst – R2R role requiring 3-5 years of experience in financial reporting, reconciliations, and compliance with Xero and ERP systems.

Business Analyst - Telecom Billing

Closing Date: 28, Feb 2026 Job Published: 18, Feb 2026 Contact Email: hiring@iinerds.com

Brief Description We are seeking skilled Telecom Billing Business Analysts with strong experience in U.S. telecom billing operations. The ideal candidates will be responsible for managing and executing end-to-end billing processes, ensuring data accuracy, performing validations, and supporting overall billing operations for telecom clients.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Execute and manage complete billing cycles for U.S.-based telecom clients.
  • Perform detailed billing validations to ensure accuracy, compliance, and data integrity.
  • Analyze billing data, identify discrepancies, and resolve issues in a timely manner.
  • Collaborate with internal teams to ensure smooth billing operations and process improvements.
  • Support data extraction, reconciliation, and reporting activities as required.
  • Directly interact with U.S. clients for requirement gathering, issue resolution, clarifications, and status updates.
  • Participate in client meetings, provide billing insights, and ensure adherence to SLAs and KPIs.
  • Work in overlapping U.S. business hours to ensure seamless communication and support.
  • Leverage AI-powered tools for data analysis, automation, reporting, anomaly detection, and process optimization.

Required Skills & Qualifications:

  • 5–8 years of hands-on experience in USA telecom billing operations.
  • Strong understanding of telecom billing processes, revenue cycles, and billing life cycle management.
  • Working knowledge of databases and SQL for data analysis and validation.
  • Experience with AI tools and platforms (such as generative AI tools, automation tools, or data analytics AI platforms) to enhance billing accuracy and efficiency.
  • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with high attention to detail.
  • Excellent communication skills with proven experience handling U.S. client interactions.
  • Ability to work during U.S. overlap hours.
  • Bachelor’s degree in Business, Finance, Information Technology, Telecommunications, or a related discipline.
  • Preferred: Certifications in Telecom Billing, Business Analysis, or Data Analytics.

This role requires candidates who can work independently, manage multiple priorities, and ensure timely and accurate billing execution.
summary: Seeking Telecom Billing Business Analysts with 5–8 years experience in U.S. telecom operations. Role involves managing billing cycles, ensuring accuracy, and leveraging AI tools for process optimization.
